meanings.definition: A placeholder for an indefinite or large number.
meanings.sent1: I need umpty pencils for the art project.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked for umpty books to be brought to the library.
meanings.sent3: I have umpty chores to do before I can go out to play.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of stamps was as vast as umpty galaxies.
meanings.sent5: The field was covered with umpty flowers, creating a colorful carpet.

meanings.sent1: He drank umpty glasses of water after the long run.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for umpty cups of sugar, but I only had a little.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map led them to a spot with umpty X marks.
meanings.sent4: The magician pulled umpty rabbits out of the hat, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent5: The box was filled with umpty toys, each one a mystery waiting to be discovered.

meanings.sent1: She had umpty reasons for not attending the party.
meanings.sent2: The project required umpty hours of work to complete.
meanings.sent3: The old house had umpty secrets hidden in its walls.
meanings.sent4: His speech was filled with umpty promises, but no real solutions.
meanings.sent5: The forest was filled with umpty shadows, making it seem mysterious and enchanting.
